articles.title: President Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Austria
articles.content:
President Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Austria 
   Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The Austrian Preparatory Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated in Vienna on July 3.
 The chairman of the Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and the DPRK was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.   
 The committee decided to hold colorful functions for remembering the brilliant life of the peerlessly great man Kim Il Sung in the capital and localities and widely introduce the undying exploits performed by him on behalf of humankind.

articles.content:
Struggle against Conclusion of FTA Declared in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The Headquarters of the All-People Movement for Checking the south Korea-U.S. Free Trade Agreement reportedly called a press conference at citizens' park of Kwanghwamun in Seoul on July 3 to declare a struggle for checking the conclusion of the FTA.
 An appeal read out at the press conference said that the headquarters will set July 12 as the day of a rally for checking the conclusion of the FTA and conduct such actions as the holding of the second all-people rally, the publication of a declaration on the political situation, a signature campaign and the sending of protest e-mails to Chongwadae and the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, calling upon all the people to come out in the actions.

Kim Yong Nam Meets Special Envoy of Indonesian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Special Envoy of Indonesian President
   Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a friendly talk with Councilor to President Nana Sutresna, special envoy of the Indonesian president, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today. 
 On hand were Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, officials concerned, Bambang Irawan K., Indonesian charge d'affaires a. i. here, and embassy officials.    
 On the occasion the special envoy said that President Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono has a firm will to further develop the friendly relations between Indonesia and Korea provided by former President Sukarno and President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Malawian Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Malawian Minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation
   Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a congratulatory message to Joyce Banda upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Malawi.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, the message wished him success in his new job.
